intro: Elaeocarpus candollei, commonly known as the Candolle’s elaeocarp, is a tropical tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces distinctive, woody fruits that are typically red or purple in color, containing one or two seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
